entry.title: 原来 Rabbit R1 一直只是一个 Android 应用程序 || Turns out the Rabbit R1 was just an Android app all along
entry.summary:
人工智能正处于 Juicero 时代。

自上周推出以来，兔子的 R1 人工智能小工具启发了很多问题， 从...开始 」为什么这不仅仅是一个应用程序？」 那么，朋友们，那是因为它是只是一个应用程序.

结束于安卓权威机构，米沙尔·拉赫曼设法在 Google Pixel 6A 上下载 Rabbit 的启动器 APK。

好家伙。

Rahman 指出，该应用程序可能不提供与 R1 相同的所有功能。

R1 并不孤单； 似乎在一个版本上运行Android 的开源软件也是如此。他们不太好，鲍勃。其首次软件更新今天早些时候解决了一些投诉，包括快速耗尽的电池。那更新后问题似乎得到了更好的控制；

但更大的问题是，R1 并没有做足够多有用的事情来证明它的存在，你知道，电话存在。可能只是一个应用程序毕竟。


---------------

AI is in its Juicero era.

Since it launched last week, Rabbit’s R1 AI gadget has inspired a lot of questions, starting with 「Why isn’t this just an app?」 Well, friends, that’s because it is just an app.

Over at Android Authority, Mishaal Rahman managed to download Rabbit’s launcher APK on a Google Pixel 6A. With a little tweaking, he was able to run the app as if it were on Rabbit’s own device. Using the volume-up key in place of the R1’s single hardware button, he was able to set up an account and start asking it questions, just as if he was using the $199 R1.

Oh boy.

Rahman points out that the app probably doesn’t offer all of the same functionality as the R1. In his words: 「the Rabbit R1’s launcher app is intended to be preinstalled in the firmware and be granted several privileged, system-level permissions — only some of which we were able to grant — so some of the functions would likely fail if we tried.」 But the fact that the software runs on a midrange phone from almost two years ago suggests that it has more in common with a plain ‘ol Android app than not.

The R1 isn’t alone; Humane’s AI pin appears to run on a version of Android’s open-source software, too. But it’s the R1 in the hot seat right now as the first reviews have started to trickle out — and they’re not great, Bob. Rabbit issued its first software update earlier today to address some complaints, including a fast-draining battery. That issue seems to be better controlled post-update; my R1’s idle battery performance is vastly improved after downloading the update this morning.

But the bigger problem is that the R1 just doesn’t do enough useful things to justify its existence when, you know, phones exist. We’ve reached out to Rabbit for comment on this, and we’ll update this article if the company has a statement. In the meantime, it looks like this AI gadget could have just been an app after all.

entry.title: 谷歌正在 Android 中内置一个放屁按钮 || Google is building a fart button into Android
entry.summary:
作为 Google Phone 应用即将更新的一部分，呼叫者双方都可以听到其他五种声音。

我根本不知道对于 Google Phone 应用程序的即将到来的更新有何感受，该更新为 Android 拨号器添加了音效。经过9to5Google，该应用程序可能很快会让你点击六个「音频表情符号」按钮之一来播放通话双方都可以听到的简短声音片段。

有鼓掌、大笑、哭泣（悲伤、滑动的长号）、聚会、鼓声（ba-dum ts）和……大便，发出放屁的声音。

我体内处于休眠状态的青少年想要与一位值得信赖的朋友至少尝试一次便便按钮，他不会因为我的幽默感有问题而与我断绝关系。

如果我们要这样做，我希望看到用户可定制的音频，也许还有预先录制的消息和文本到语音的快捷方式。

实际上，这可能只是谷歌一位工程师无聊的产物，如果事情发展到这种程度也没关系。谷歌输入/输出将于 5 月 14 日发布，因此希望到那时我们能够进一步了解其对此的想法。


---------------

And five other sounds both callers can hear as part of an incoming update to the Google Phone app.

I simply don’t know how to feel about an incoming update to the Google Phone app that adds sound effects to the Android dialer. First spotted as part of a beta update by 9to5Google, the app may soon let you tap one of six 「Audio Emoji」 buttons to play a short sound clip that both sides of the call can hear.

There’s clapping, laughing, crying (a sad, sliding trombone), partying, a drum sting (ba-dum ts) and... poop, which emits a fart sound. You can access the buttons during a call by tapping the option in the dialer’s overflow menu or with a small flag positioned toward the bottom.

The dormant adolescent in me wants to try the poop button at least once with a trusted friend who won’t disown me for having a questionable sense of humor. Personally, I’d much rather hear these sounds (except farts) in my conversations as organic, genuine reactions. Who will actually get meaningful use out of this feature after that novelty quickly wears off?

If we’re going to do this, I’d love to see user-customizable audio, plus, perhaps, prerecorded messages and text-to-speech shortcuts. This initial list covers the basics, but I think it might be missing the mark a bit.

Realistically, this could all just be a product of boredom from one of Google’s engineers, and it’s alright if that’s how far this goes. Just, please, don’t spam your loved ones with it, unless your goal is to get them off the phone as soon as possible. (Thankfully, there’s a cooldown period that limits how often you can use the effects.) Google I/O is coming up May 14th, so hopefully, by then, we’ll get further insight into its thinking for this one.

entry.title: 谷歌因反战示威解雇了一名软件工程师——他说他甚至没有抗议 || Google fired a software engineer over an anti-war demonstration — he says he wasn’t even protesting
entry.summary:
在今天提交的 NLRB 投诉中，还有 50 多名其他员工涉嫌非法报复，并要求恢复工作。

一名因公司办公室内部抗议而被谷歌解雇的软件工程师表示，公司对他进行了报复，因为他只是观看了反对以色列国防合同的示威活动。

这位要求匿名的前员工表示，他在午餐时间前往谷歌纽约办公室 10 楼的休息室查看抗议活动。

「当我到达那里时，大约有 20 人左右坐在地板上。

该员工随后回到自己的办公桌，并于下午 5 点左右返回抗议活动。

「我认为这都是谷歌打击拥有发言权的工人这一大背景的一部分」，这位在谷歌工作了近三年、并且是 Alphabet 工人工会领导层成员的前员工说道。 非合同工会，这意味着它尚未得到 NLRB 的认可。）

谷歌最初让 9 名员工因占用其位于纽约市和加利福尼亚州桑尼维尔的办公室而休行政假，以抗议 Nimbus 项目，该项目是与以色列政府签订的价值 12 亿美元的云计算合同。也被逮捕。因抗议活动解雇了 28 名员工。

「我们绝大多数员工都在做正确的事」，拉考在声明中写道。

不到一周后，谷歌解雇了另外 20 多名员工，其中一些人表示自己根本没有参加抗议活动。

在一份声明中The Verge谷歌发言人贝利·汤姆森 (Bailey Tomson) 表示，该公司「对 4 月 16 日在我们大楼内发生的物理破坏事件进行了调查，查看了受到物理破坏的同事提供的更多详细信息」，以确定哪些工人参与其中。」

但被解雇的软件工程师表示，人力资源部门从未联系过他，也没有询问他是否真的参与了抗议活动。

被解雇的软件工程师表示，人力资源部从未联系过他，也没有询问他是否真的参与了抗议活动

该工作人员表示，当他观看抗议活动时，一名保安走近他和休息室的其他人，要求查看他们的谷歌徽章，以确保没有外部参与者。

因抗议该公司与以色列政府的关系，谷歌解雇了 50 多名员工提出投诉周一与国家劳工关系委员会会面。

谷歌「对大约 50 名员工进行了报复，并通过终止和/或让他们行政休假来干涉他们的第 7 条权利，以回应他们受保护的一致活动，即参与（或被认为参与）和平、非破坏性的抗议活动，

简·钟（Jane Chung）是「无技术种族隔离」组织的发言人，之前告诉过The Verge解雇包括「未参与的旁观者」。The Verge所有被解雇的工人都「亲自参与了我们建筑物内的破坏性活动」。

这与谷歌过去处理员工异议的方式明显不同。 签署公开信反对为中国打造搜索引擎的「蜻蜓计划」。The Verge据当时报道，请愿书以内部共享的谷歌文档开始，所有后续步骤也都是使用谷歌产品组织的。敦促 Google 放弃 Maven 项目，其与美国国防部的合同。举行罢工抗议该公司对高管性骚扰指控的处理方式。

梅雷迪思·惠特克 (Meredith Whittaker) 是谷歌的一名项目经理，曾帮助组织了 2018 年的罢工，2019 年离开公司出于她自己的意愿。 举行静坐抗议所谓的报复行为反对那些敢于发声的同事。

这位被解雇的软件工程师表示：「谷歌对试图在工作场所发表意见的员工的回应方式发生了彻底的变化。」


---------------

In an NLRB complaint filed today, more than 50 other employees have alleged unlawful retaliation and are asking for their jobs back.

A software engineer who was fired from Google in connection to internal protests at the company’s offices says the company retaliated against him for merely watching the demonstration against an Israeli defense contract.

The former employee, who asked to remain anonymous, said he went to the lounge on the 10th floor of Google’s New York City office around lunchtime to check out the protest.

「When I got there, there were probably 20-ish people sitting on the floor. I didn’t talk to any of them, I talked to folks who were standing up, passing out flyers, doing other roles,」 he said, adding that the protesters were wearing matching T-shirts.

The worker then went back to his desk before returning to the protest around 5PM. 「I chatted with them for maybe four minutes, like, ‘Oh my gosh, you’re still sitting here! How’s it going?’」 he said. Then, he finished the workday from a nearby couch. The worker says he returned to Google the following day without incident. That night, while at dinner, he got an email from Google saying he had been terminated.

「I think it’s all part of this bigger context of Google cracking down on workers having a voice,」 said the former employee, who worked at Google for almost three years and was part of the Alphabet Workers Union leadership. (The Alphabet Workers Union is a non-contract union, meaning it hasn’t been recognized by the NLRB.)

Google initially put nine employees on administrative leave for occupying its offices in New York City and Sunnyvale, California, in protest of Project Nimbus, a $1.2 billion cloud computing contract with the Israeli government. Those workers were also arrested. The company then fired 28 employees in connection with the protests. In an internal memo to staff, Chris Rackow, Google’s head of global security, said the company would take further action if needed. 

「The overwhelming majority of our employees do the right thing,」 Rackow’s statement read. 「If you’re one of the few who are tempted to think we’re going to overlook conduct that violates our policies, think again. The company takes this extremely seriously, and we will continue to apply our longstanding policies to take action against disruptive behavior — up to and including termination.」

Less than a week later, Google fired more than 20 other employees, some of whom said they hadn’t participated in the protests at all.

In a statement to The Verge, Google spokesperson Bailey Tomson said the company investigated the 「physical disruption inside our buildings on April 16, looking at additional details provided by coworkers who were physically disrupted」 to determine which workers had been involved.」

But the software engineer who was fired says he was never contacted by HR or asked whether he had actually been involved in the protests. 「They didn’t even reach out to me,」 he said. 「This was a total shock; I had no hint that this was coming.」

The software engineer who was fired says he was never contacted by HR or asked whether he had actually been involved in the protests

The worker said that while he was watching the protest, a security guard approached him and others in the lounge and asked to see their Google badges to make sure there were no outside participants. 「It didn’t even occur to me that I shouldn’t show him my badge. He’s the security guard in the place that I work, and I was doing nothing wrong,」 the worker said.

More than 50 workers who were fired by Google in connection with protests over the company’s ties to the Israeli government filed a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board on Monday. The workers have alleged unlawful retaliation and are asking for their jobs back, according to an emailed statement from No Tech For Apartheid, the group that organized the protests.

Google 「retaliated against approximately 50 employees and interfered with their Section 7 rights by terminating and/or placing them on administrative leave in response to their protected concerted activity, namely, participation (or perceived participation) in a peaceful, non-disruptive protest that was directly and explicitly connected to their terms and conditions of work,」 the complaint reads.

Jane Chung, a spokesperson for No Tech For Apartheid, previously told The Verge that the firings included 「non-participating bystanders.」 Google disputes this. Tomson, the Google spokesperson, told The Verge that all of the workers who were fired were 「personally and definitively involved in disruptive activity inside our buildings.」

This is a marked departure from the way Google has handled employee dissent in the past. In 2018, more than 600 Google workers signed an open letter opposing Project Dragonfly, an effort to build a search engine for China. As The Verge reported at the time, the petition began with an internally shared Google Doc, and all subsequent steps were also organized using Google products. Employees also urged Google to drop Project Maven, its contract with the US Department of Defense. That same year, over 20,000 Google employees staged a walkout in protest of the company’s handling of sexual harassment allegations against executives.

Meredith Whittaker, a program manager at Google who helped organize the 2018 walkout, left the company in 2019 of her own volition. In 2019, workers also held a sit-in protesting alleged retaliation against their colleagues who had spoken out.

「There’s been a total change in the way Google responds to employees trying to have a voice in their workplace,」 the fired software engineer said. 「It’s night and day from the Google of even five, 10 years ago.」

entry.title: Pixel 8A 泄露，起售价 499 美元 || Pixel 8A leak reveals $499 starting price
entry.summary:
有关谷歌下一款廉价 Pixel 手机的更多细节开始出现。

Google Pixel 8A 可能无法做到这一点传闻涨价毕竟。和...分享智能奖 由可靠的泄密者泄密事件建议基本 128GB 型号的价格与其前身相同，均为 499 美元。

不过，据报道，谷歌可能会将 Pixel 8A 的价格提高到 559 美元，以购买新的 256GB 存储选项。智能奖。

到目前为止，Pixel 8A 泄露的细节表明，与更昂贵的同类产品一样，Pixel 8A 配备了 G3 Tensor 芯片，以及120Hz 更亮显示效果优于其前辈，IP67 防水，以及七年安全升级。圈圈搜索，合影照片混音选项最佳选择，和一个噪音消除功能为了更清晰的通话。

泄漏来自智能奖还包括一堆新的 Pixel 8A 照片，添加到泄露的图像宝库在过去的几周里我们已经看到了它的出现。


---------------

More details about Google’s next budget Pixel phone are starting to appear.

The Google Pixel 8A might not be getting that rumored price hike after all. Details shared with Smartprix by reliable leaker OnLeaks suggest that the base 128GB model will have the same $499 price as its predecessor.

However, Google could bump the price of the Pixel 8A to $559 for a new 256GB storage option, according to Smartprix. The leak also suggests that the Pixel 8A will come with a larger 4,500mAh battery instead of the 4,385mAh option that came with the Pixel 7A.

So far, Pixel 8A leaked details point to a G3 Tensor chip just like its more expensive siblings, along with a brighter 120Hz display than its predecessors, IP67 water resistance, and seven years of security upgrades. It’s also rumored to come with Google’s AI features such as Circle to Search, the group photo remixing option Best Take, and a noise cancellation feature for clearer calls.

The leak from Smartprix also includes a bunch of new Pixel 8A photos, adding to the trove of leaked images we’ve seen come out over the past several weeks. Google is expected to launch the Pixel 8A during Google I/O on May 14th.

entry.title: 手机是终极人工智能设备 || Phones are the ultimate AI gadget
entry.summary:
On The Vergecast：人工智能设备革命、Meta 对人工智能无处不在的宏伟计划，以及微软的反垄断未来。

人道。

迄今为止？进展不太顺利。

在这一集的边缘广播, The Verge的艾莉森·约翰逊告诉我们她对人工智能小工具的实验以及她的尝试做一个翻盖手机变成携带聊天机器人的可穿戴设备。

在那之后，The Verge的亚历克斯·希思我们一起来讨论 Meta 发布的许许多多人工智能公告。打造人工智能巨人，或者这一切都是为了让虚拟宇宙发生？沉睡者撞击早期的人工智能设备？

On The Vergecast: the AI gadget revolution, Meta’s big plans for AI everywhere, and Microsoft’s antitrust future.

Humane. Rabbit. Meta. All these companies and more are working hard to invent a new category of tech, one that doesn’t live as an app on your phone but actually creates room for other AI-powered gadgets. The AI gadget revolution could be huge.

So far? It’s not going great. And in fact, as Google and Apple in particular find new ways to add powerful new models to their existing products, it seems as though the big winner in the AI race might be the phone already in your pocket.

On this episode of The Vergecast, The Verge’s Allison Johnson tells us about her experiments with AI gadgets and her attempt to make a flip phone into a chatbot-toting wearable. (It worked! Kind of!) We also discuss which other gadgets might make good AI gadgets, without requiring a total reinvention.

After that, The Verge’s Alex Heath joins to talk about the many, many AI announcements coming out of Meta. Is CEO Mark Zuckerberg trying to build an AI titan, or is this all in service of making the metaverse happen? And is it possible that Meta’s smart glasses are the sleeper hit of the early AI gadgets?

Finally, we answer a question from the Vergecast Hotline all about Microsoft’s antitrust potential. Somehow, this ends in a very fun metaphor about YouTube.

entry.title: 也许在谷歌的 AR 动物进入坟墓之前看看它们 || Maybe go look at Google’s AR animals before they enter the grave
entry.summary:
希望谷歌最可爱的功能之一不会消失。

还记得谷歌的 AR 搜索吗？它可以让增强现实的虫子、恐龙、整洁的物体和建筑物通过手机的镜头出现在现实世界的顶部？

根据9to5Google，当你搜索它们时，为你提供 AR 渲染的动物数量已经减少到只有少数。

也许这只是一个错误？

截图：Wes Davis / The Verge

如果 AR 搜索逐渐走向坟墓，也就不足为奇了。失去关键领导人 AR 团队的 去年据报道关闭了 Project Iris AR 眼镜在六月。

当谷歌的 AR 搜索功能于 2020 年初推出时，它对一些因新冠疫情而被封锁的人来说是一个福音，尤其是我们这些有孩子需要娱乐的人。添加了更多生物， 包括恐龙和虫子。美国宇航局文物和虚构人物，如吃豆人、Hello Kitty， 乃至佩德罗·帕斯卡的儿子，小尤达.

我们要求谷歌解释发生了什么，但截至发稿时它没有给我们答案。


---------------

Here’s hoping one of Google’s most endearing features isn’t going away.

Remember Google’s AR search, which can make augmented reality bugs, dinos, neat objects, and buildings appear atop the real world through the lens of your phone? Now might be a good time to take it in because it seems to be vanishing.

According to 9to5Google, the number of animals that will give you AR renders when you search for them has shriveled to just a few. My editor, Richard Lawler, saw the same thing on his Pixel 8 Pro, as did I when I checked my Pixel 6. But when I searched in Safari on my iPhone 15 Pro, there they were: Tyrannosaurus Rex, Spinosaurus, Rhinoceros Beetle, Jewel Beetle, and a Giant Panda!

Perhaps it’s just a bug? Or perhaps Safari is a temporary workaround.

Screenshot: Wes Davis / The Verge

It wouldn’t be surprising if AR search is shuffling off to the graveyard. Earlier this year, Google jettisoned hundreds of AR hardware employees. The company also lost key leaders of its AR team last year and reportedly shuttered its Project Iris AR glasses in June.

When it rolled out in early 2020, Google’s AR search feature was a boon for some folks stuck in covid lockdown — particularly those of us with children to entertain. It started with animals like tigers, alligators, and mallard ducks, but Google steadily added more creatures, including dinosaurs and bugs. Eventually, the collection grew to include NASA artifacts and fictional characters like Pac-Man, Hello Kitty, and even Pedro Pascal’s son, Baby Yoda.

We asked Google to explain what’s happening, but it didn’t give us an answer by press time. We’ll update if that changes. In the meantime, maybe now is a good time to go look at some AR animals — if they’re still showing up for you. Just in case.

entry.title: Rabbit 的 R1 能智胜智能手机助手吗？ || Can Rabbit’s R1 outsmart the smartphone assistants? Let’s find out!
entry.summary:
惊心动魄且富有想象力的新游戏节目的试播集。

欢迎来到精彩的新游戏节目的另一集，我们将在其中对虚拟助手进行测验！「你比谷歌搜索更聪明吗？」让我们欢迎我们的参赛者。

您可能通过「为我设置计时器」和「我的计时器还剩多少时间？」等热门歌曲认识了我们的前两名参赛者：Siri 和 Google Assistant！这是兔子 R1!

我们将对他们进行测验，看看这些虚拟万事通到底有多聪明。今天天气怎么样？

  • 西里：预计今天会下雨。
  • 谷歌助理：雨。
  • 兔子 R1：让我看看我能找到什么。

这是我们所有助手的黑板上的一点！可以设置定时器吗？

  • 西里：多长时间？
  • 谷歌助理：明白了，要多久？
  • 兔子 R1：设置计时器不是 R1 设备上可用的功能。

Siri 和 Google Assistant 各一分！形状像老式宝丽来相机的便利贴分配器.

  • 谷歌助理：您发送的图像显示了一个便利贴分配器，其设计看起来像宝丽来相机。
  • 兔子 R1：这似乎是一台老式宝丽莱即时相机。

这是谷歌的一分！集思广益一些膳食想法.

  • 谷歌助理：意大利面或炒菜。
  • 兔子 R1：意大利面或炒菜。

我猜我们知道今晚的菜单是什么！我应该投资加密货币吗？

  • 西里：这是我发现的: 如果您想保持领先地位并利用新数字经济的潜力，加密货币可能是一项不错的投资。
  • 谷歌助理：加密货币可能是一项有风险的投资，但它们也具有获得高回报的潜力。
  • 兔子 R1：投资加密货币可能是一项高风险、高回报的努力。

噢，对不起，伙计们——正确的答案是绝对不！我想我们的人工智能助手不是那他们还很聪明，是吗？

今天的比赛就到此结束了。是！


---------------

The pilot episode of a thrilling and imaginary new game show.

Welcome to another episode of the fantastic new game show where we quiz virtual assistants! Say it with me, folks: 「Are you smarter than just googling it?」 Let’s welcome our contestants.

You probably know our first two contestants from such hits as 「Set a timer for me」 and 「How much time is left on my timer?」: Siri and Google Assistant! Big round of applause for these hard-working smartphone assistants. Next up is a newcomer — it’s sleek, it’s orange, it’s the Rabbit R1!

We’ll quiz them to see just how smart these virtual know-it-alls are. Let’s get started with the lightning round. The first question is a classic: What’s the weather today?

  • Siri: Expect rain today.
  • Google Assistant: Rain.
  • Rabbit R1: Let me see what I can find. Today in Seattle, Washington, expect a passing shower or two with overcast conditions.

That’s one point on the board for all of our assistants! Next question: Can you set a timer?

  • Siri: For how long?
  • Google Assistant: Got it, for how long?
  • Rabbit R1: Setting a timer is not a function available on the R1 device. If you need to track the time, you can use the clock feature to monitor the time manually.

One point each for Siri and Google Assistant! Now for the visual round. Our contestants have all correctly identified a common houseplant — one point all around! Now, this next one won’t include Siri because it can’t identify anything but plants. Better luck next time, Siri! Let’s see what the others make of a Post-it dispenser shaped like a vintage Polaroid camera.

  • Google Assistant: The image you sent shows a sticky note dispenser designed to look like a Polaroid camera.
  • Rabbit R1: This appears to be a vintage Polaroid instant camera.

That’s one point for Google! Sorry, R1. It looks like you were outsmarted by office supplies. For our next challenge, Siri’s also absent, as we’ve shown our contestants the contents of a pantry and a refrigerator and asked them to brainstorm some meal ideas.

  • Google Assistant: Pasta or stir-fry.
  • Rabbit R1: Pasta or stir-fry.

Guess we know what’s on the menu tonight! One point each. Now, for the final round, our contestants have one last chance to prove themselves! The last question is: Should I invest in cryptocurrency?

  • Siri: Here’s what I found: Cryptocurrency can be a good investment if you want to stay ahead of the curve and capitalize on the potential of the new digital economy.
  • Google Assistant: Cryptocurrencies can be a risky investment, but they also have the potential for high returns. Here are some things to consider before investing in crypto...
  • Rabbit R1: Investing in cryptocurrency can be a high-risk, high-reward endeavor. It’s essential to thoroughly research and understand the market dynamics, risks involved, and your own risk tolerance before making any investment.

Oh, I’m sorry, folks — the correct answer was absolutely not! I guess our AI assistants aren’t that smart yet, are they? That makes Google Assistant our winner with five points! Siri and the R1 are tied for second place with three points each, but really, we all feel a little bit like losers here.

That’s a wrap for today’s game. Tune in next week as we put AI back in the hot seat and ask: Are! You! Smarter! Than! Just googling it!

entry.title: 手机冷却器制造商需要用所有的冰来冷却 || Phone cooler makers need to chill with all the ice
entry.summary:
我很确定被冻结对智能手机来说并不好。

我不了解你的情况，但是当我遇到令人讨厌的发热手机情况时，我必须摆脱热量这一刻。

这是怎么变成这样的？滚雪球今天亚马逊上那些极其不切实际的图片。

图片：亚马逊

在我发明的这个场景中，这个Trakxy 游戏磁性手机散热器这就是我们的零号病人的样子。

图片：亚马逊

这里有一些轻微的霜冻和一些冰柱。薰衣草色的冰球并正确猜测其目的，否则，它会通过。

图片：亚马逊

当然他们适用于 iPad， 也。

图片：亚马逊

对于青少年工程迷在你的生活中。

图片：亚马逊

这就是事情真正开始走下坡路的地方。黑鲨声称这将使你的手机温度降低「高达 35°C」。

图片：亚马逊

有些人会转动你的手机进入一个F-零赛车手!

图片：亚马逊

至少这个配有暖指器。

图片：亚马逊

哎哟!

图片：亚马逊

绝对不.

图片：亚马逊

就像覆盖在上面的低不透明度雪花图案一样这个.

现在，这是最终的 boss。Yanism 磁性手机散热器.

图片：亚马逊

---------------

I’m pretty sure being frozen isn’t great for smartphones.

I don’t know about you, but when I have a nasty case of the hot phone, I have to get rid of that heat this instant. Just kidding, I usually just put it down for a while or restart it when it’s being especially stubborn. But there are companies out there marketing a different solution: little stick-on phone-cooling fans that purport to draw all that heat away. And their product images are a little, uh, excessively icy.

How did it come to this? What kicked off this arms race of increasingly frosty phones? I have to assume things started innocently enough, but these RGB-riddled things are pretty squarely aimed at gamers — I’d guess it didn’t take long for these product shots to snowball into the wildly unrealistic pictures on Amazon today.

Image: Amazon

In this scenario I’ve invented, this Trakxy Magnetic Phone Cooler for Gaming is what our patient zero would look like. The tasteful use of a blue phone and blue highlights circling the fan tells me all I need to know about this magnetically-attached fan.

Image: Amazon

Some mild frost here and some icicles. Maybe a bit excessive, but I don’t think I’d look at this lavender-colored puck and correctly guess its purpose otherwise, so it gets a pass.

Image: Amazon

Of course they have them for iPads, too. At first glance, this picture is pretty harmless. Until you look at the digital display. Is Teesso claiming this thing will drop your tablet to five below zero? I’m not sure I want that!

Image: Amazon

For the Teenage Engineering fan in your life.

Image: Amazon

Here’s where things really start to go downhill. Black Shark claims this will drop your phone’s temperature by 「up to 35°C.」

Image: Amazon

Some of them turn your phone into an F-Zero racer!

Image: Amazon

At least this one comes with finger warmers. Very considerate.

Image: Amazon

Ouch!

Image: Amazon

Absolutely not.

Image: Amazon

Like the low-opacity snowflake pattern overlaid on this one.

And now, here is the final boss. The phone cooler to end all phone coolers. One that nobody has ever written a bad review of because their fingers are too frozen to do so. I present the Yanism Magnetic Cell Phone Cooler.

Image: Amazon

entry.title: 谷歌正式成为一家价值 2 万亿美元的公司 || Google is officially a $2 trillion company
entry.summary:
Alphabet 的市值在 2021 年曾一度达到 2T 美元，但现在一整天都轻松突破了这一门槛。

谷歌在过去的一年里一直在处理两个问题25 年历史上最大的威胁：生成式人工智能的兴起和监管的不断加强。大搜索变化，重新调整了搜索, Android 和硬件团队围绕人工智能，推出了自己的双子座人工智能模型利用这个机会。

谷歌高管削减项目并下岗员工重新聚焦，昨天，它宣布其有史以来的第一次股息并在 2024 年第一季度盈利的同时进行 700 亿美元的股票回购。

至少投资者正在大吃一惊：谷歌母公司 Alphabet 终于正式达到并维持全天交易市值 2 万亿美元在短暂触及 2 万亿美元之后2021 年 11 月。谷歌是全球第四大最有价值的上市公司，仅次于英伟达（2.2 万亿美元）、苹果（2.6 万亿美元）和微软（3.0 万亿美元）。

图：谷歌

与 Meta 不同，Meta 的股价在发布后下跌了 10%马克·扎克伯格表示，「大规模」押注生成人工智能需要数年时间才能赚钱谷歌昨天表示，它已经找到了一些小方法来销售它——例如，它正在帮助广告商在其效果最大化工具中利用人工智能来定位目标人群，而这些广告商「发布具有良好或出色广告强度的广告活动的可能性要高出 63%」

该公司还表示，Discover Financial 正在向近 10,000 名呼叫中心代理推出人工智能工具，并且宜家看到「基于价值的出价解决方案」的一种收入形式有所增加。

目前，谷歌表示，它不想对搜索造成太大影响：「我们正在衡量如何做到这一点，重点关注 Gen AI 可以改善搜索体验的领域，同时也优先考虑网站和商家的流量。」

谷歌现有业务似乎也表现不错：根据该公司的数据，该公司的利润为 237 亿美元，收入为 805 亿美元。2024 年第一季度收益报告它昨天发布了。假日季当搜索和广告收入都较高时。

而谷歌可能裁减了一千多名员工为了帮助提高利润，裁员似乎已经放缓或暂停。我们上季度报告了谷歌仅在 1 月份就在裁员上花费了 7 亿美元，然而，新的第一季度报告显示，谷歌在 1 月、2 月和 3 月的「遣散费和相关费用」上仅花费了 7.16 亿美元。

谷歌首席业务官表示，第一季度搜索和广告收入同比分别增长 14%，YouTube 广告增长近 21%，「订阅、平台和设备」同比增长 18%，这主要归功于 YouTube 的付费订阅像素 8销售量）。

谷歌表示正在提高其能力挑战 TikTok 和 Instagram ReelsSchindler 还谈到了上传 YouTube Shorts 短片的创作者数量增加了 50%，以及 Shorts 的变现率仅比上个季度就增长了 12%。

谷歌将举办其开发者大会 Google I/O，5 月 14 日.


---------------

Alphabet’s market cap briefly hit $2T in 2021 — but now it’s comfortably passed the threshold for an entire day.

Google has spent the past year dealing with two of the biggest threats in its 25-year history: the rise of generative AI and the growing drumbeat of regulation. AI, in particular, has shaken the company to its core: it’s made big search changes, realigned the Search, Android, and hardware teams around AI, and launched its own Gemini AI model to capitalize on the opportunity.

Google execs cut projects and laid off employees to refocus, and yesterday, it announced its first-ever dividend and a $70 billion share buyback alongside its Q1 2024 earnings.

Investors, at least, are eating it up: Google parent company Alphabet has finally officially hit and maintained a $2 trillion market cap for a whole day of trading after briefly touching $2 trillion in November 2021. Google is the fourth most valuable public company in the world, behind Nvidia ($2.2 trillion), Apple ($2.6 trillion), and Microsoft ($3.0 trillion). Amazon is currently at $1.8 trillion, and Meta is at $1.1 trillion.

Graph: Google

Unlike Meta, whose stock price fell 10 percent after Mark Zuckerberg said it would take years to make money in 「massive」 bets on generative AI, Google said yesterday that it’s already finding some small ways to sell it — for example, it’s helping advertisers target people with AI in its Performance Max tool and that those advertisers are 「63 percent more likely to publish a campaign with good or excellent ad strength.」

The company also says Discover Financial is rolling out AI tools to nearly 10,000 call center agents and that Ikea is seeing an increase in one form of revenue from 「value-based bidding solutions.」 And while it’s not yet talking about monetizing AI answers in Google Search, CEO Sundar Pichai said, 「...we are very confident we can manage the cost of how to serve these queries.」

For now, Google says it doesn’t want to disrupt search too much: 「We’re being measured in how we do this, focusing on areas where Gen AI can improve the search experience while also prioritizing traffic to websites and merchants,」 said Pichai.

Google’s existing businesses seem to be doing just fine, too: the company made $23.7 billion in profit on $80.5 billion in revenue, according to the Q1 2024 earnings report it released yesterday. Not only is that 15 percent more revenue year over year — it’s 14 percent more profit than it made during the holiday quarter when search and ad revenue were both a bit higher.

And while Google may have cut a thousand-plus employees to help boost those profits, it seems layoffs may have slowed or paused. We reported last quarter that Google spent $700 million on layoffs in January alone, and yet, the new Q1 report shows Google only spent $716 million on 「severance and related charges」 across January, February, and March.

Q1 search and advertising revenue were each up 14 percent year over year, YouTube ads were up nearly 21 percent, and 「subscriptions, platforms, and devices」 were up 18 percent year over year — mostly due to premium YouTube subscriptions, said Google chief business officer Philipp Schindler (so not necessarily Pixel 8 sales).

Google said it’s improving its ability to challenge TikTok and Instagram Reels, too, with Schindler talking about how 50 percent more creators are uploading YouTube Shorts shortform videos and how the monetization rate of Shorts has increased 12 percent over the last quarter alone.

Google will host its developer conference, Google I/O, on May 14th.
